model:
&types; QOS DSCP 0x00 0x01 0x02 0x03 0x04 0x05 0x06 0x07 0x08 0x09 0x0a 0x0b 0x0c 0x0d 0x0e 0x0f 0x10 0x11 0x12 0x13 0x14 0x15 0x16 0x17 0x18 0x19 0x1a 0x1b 0x1c 0x1d 0x1e 0x1f 0x20 0x21 0x22 0x23 0x24 0x25 0x26 0x27 0x28 0x29 0x2a 0x2b 0x2c 0x2d 0x2e 0x2f 0x30 0x31 0x32 0x33 0x34 0x35 0x36 0x37 0x38 0x39 0x3a 0x3b 0x3c 0x3d 0x3e 0x3f 0x00 The Differentiated Services Code Point, or DSCP, tells the network how to handle the data packets transmitted by the phone and what the performance requirement are with regards to, for example, delay, loss and jitter. The normal setting for VoIP is 0x2e
( < qosDscp > )
VLAN-ID (0-4094) 0 The VLAN-ID indicates the VLAN on which the phone resides
( < qosVlanId > )
Phone Settings DND FALSE If checked, the phone switches to do-not-disturb mode
( < dndControl > )
Blink Light on Incoming Calls TRUE If checked, the LED lamp on the top of the phone starts blinking on incoming calls
( < blinkLightOnIncomingCall > )
Enable Flashing for MWI Indicator TRUE If checked, the LED lamp on the top of the phone flashes red for indicating new Voicemail or Instant messages If unchecked, the LED lamp on the top of the phone will be solid red for indicating new Voicemail or Instant messages
( < flashLightOnMwi > )
Enable IM Beep Alert TRUE If checked, the phone beeps when it receives an IM
( < imBeepAlert > )
Enable Syslog FALSE If checked, the phone sends the SIP message logs to Syslog Server
( < imBeepAlert > )
Syslog Server IP address of a syslog server for logging of SIP messages received from and sent to the phone
( < syslogServer > )
Enable Session Timer FALSE If checked, the phone uses a 'keepalive' mechanism in order to better detect whether a call has been disconnected
( < enableSessionTimer > )
Session Timer(sec) 30 Time after which the 'keepalive' is sent
( < sessionTimerInSec > )
Enable Session Refresher Flag FALSE ( < sessionRefresherFlag > )
Group Paging Prefix Prefix used to page a group of extensions
( < groupPagingPrefix > )
Hot Desking Auto Login TRUE If checked, the phone logs in automatically using the User IDs that are configured for Lines
( < hotDeskingAutoLogin > )
Conference Server URI Domain name or IP address of the conference server
( < conferenceServerAddress > )
MoH Server URI URI of Music On Hold server. If specified music is played at the remote end when the call is placed on hold
( < mohServer > )


AutoCallback Timeout (mins) 15 Time in minutes after which auto callback is deactivated
( < autoCallbackTimeout > )
Use RFC 2543 HOLD Scheme FALSE If checked, the phone uses HOLD scheme as defined in the RFC 2543
( < useRFC2543HoldScheme > )
INFO DTMF Content-Type application/dtmf-relay application/vnd.nortelnetworks.digits application/dtmf-relay If application/dtmf-relay is selected, the phone uses application/dtmf-relay as the value for Content-Type: header in the SIP INFO method. If application/vnd.nortelnetworks.digits is selected, the phone uses application/vnd.nortelnetworks.digits as the value for Content-Type: header in the SIP INFO method
( < infoDTMFContentType > )
Audio Path When Handset On Cradle Handsfree handsfree Headset headset handsfree The selected path is used as the default audio path when handset is on cradle
( < onhookDefaultMode > )
NAT Traversal NAT Traversal Method None none SIP PING sip ping Static static none If SIP PING is selected then SIP PING scheme is used for NAT Traversal. If static is selected then the NAT address as defined below in NAT Address field is used. Select none to disable NAT Traversal
( < natTraversal > )
NAT Address If you have a NAT/Firewall that you want to traverse, specify its WAN, or outside, IP address
( < natAddress > )
SIP PING Timer Value (sec) This is the time interval in seconds after which the SIP PING request will be sent
( < sipPingTimer > )
Time Settings Time Servers manual default default If default is selected, the default time servers which are pre-configured in the phone are used. Select manual to configure the time servers manually
( < timesettings > )
Time Server 1 Domain name or IP address of time server 1
( < ntpIp > )
Time Server 2 Domain name or IP address of time server 2
( < ntpIp2 > )
Time Zone -12:00 Date Line -11:00 Nome -10:00 Hawaii -09:00 Alaska -08:00 Pacific -08:00 Tijuana -07:00 Arizona -07:00 Mountain -06:00 Central -06:00 Mexico city -06:00 Saskatchewan -05:00 Bogota, Lima -05:00 Eastern -05:00 Indiana -04:00 Atlantic -04:00 Caracas -04:00 Santiago -03:30 NewFoundland -03:00 Brasilia -03:00 Georgetown -02:00 Mid-Atlantic -01:00 Azores +00:00 Casablanca +00:00 GMT London +01:00 Amsterdam +01:00 Belgrade +01:00 Brussels +01:00 Sarajevo +02:00 Athens +02:00 Minsk +02:00 Bucharest +02:00 Cairo +02:00 Harare +02:00 Helsinki +02:00 Jerusalem +03:00 Baghdad +03:00 Moscow +03:00 Nairobi +03:30 Tehran, Iran +04:00 Abu Dhabi +04:00 Baku +04:00 Tbilisi +04:30 Afghanistan +05:00 Yekaterinburg +05:00 Pakistan +05:30 India +06:00 Astana +06:00 Srilanka +07:00 Bangkok +08:00 Beijing +08:00 Perth +08:00 Singapore +08:00 Taipei +09:00 Japan +09:00 Seoul +09:00 Yakutsk +09:30 Adelaide +09:30 Darwin +10:00 Brisbane +10:00 Canberra +10:00 Guam +10:00 Hobart +10:00 Vladivostok +11:00 Solomon Is +12:00 New Zealand +12:00 Fiji +00:00 GMT London ( < timezone > )
Enable DST FALSE If checked, this will enable the Daylight Saving Time for the selected timezone, if applicable
( < dstAutoAdjust > )
Presence RLS Subscription URI URI that the phone subscribes to get BLF SIP Events
( < sipRlsUri > )
Call Park Call Park Method Ask for Orbit none One Touch Park Orbit prefix Incall DTMF incall DTMF none If Ask for Orbit is selected the phone will prompt to dial a park orbit when the PARK softkey is pressed. If One Touch Park Orbit or Incall DTMF is selected, the phone will park the call automatically to the orbit specified in One Touch Park Orbit field specified below. To use the Incall DTMF call park method the server must support the Incall DTMF call parking
( < callParkMethod > )
One Touch Park Orbit One touch park orbit or incall DTMF string
( < callParkExtention > )
Call Unpark Prefix Prefix to the extension dialed to unpark the parked calls
( < callRtrvPrefix > )


Call Pickup Server Assisted Call PickUp TRUE If checked, the phone uses Call PickUp Prefix to pick up a ringing extension
( < serverAssistCallPickup > )
Call PickUp Prefix Prefix used for Call Pickup
( < callPickupPrefix > )


Intercom Intercom Invocation callInfoHeader alertInfoHeader intercomPrefix callInfoHeader If callInfoHeader is selected, the phone sends Call-Info header in INVITE for intercom. If alertInfoHeader is selected, the phone sends Alert-Info header in INVITE for intercom. If intercomPrefix is selected, phone uses the Intercom Prefix Value for Intercom invocation
( < intercom > )
Intercom Prefix Value Prefix used for Intercom invocation
( < intercomPrefixValue > )
Alert-Info Secret This value is compared with the secret in the Alert-Info header of incoming INVITE. Intercom call starts if the secret matches with this value. This value is also used as a secret in Alert-Info header of outgoing INVITE
( < alertInfoSecret > )
sendrecv attribute in outgoing intercom FALSE If checked, sendrecv direction attribute will be sent in SDP of outgoing INVITE for intercom
If unchecked send only direction attribute is sent
( < sendrecvInOutgoingIntercom > )


sendrecv attribute in incoming intercom FALSE If checked, sendrecv direction attribute will be sent in SDP answer of incoming intercom INVITE
If unchecked recvonly direction attribute is sent
( < sendrecvInIncomingIntercom > )


Intercom Timeout(sec) 15 Intercom timeout is the time in seconds after which an inbound intercom call disconnects. Intercom timeout is disabled if this value is set to 0
( < intercomTimeout > )
SIP Settings SIP Port 5060 The port at which you wish the other party to contact you
( < sipPort > )
Offhook on Third-Party Refer FALSE If checked, the phone automatically goes offhook when it receives a third-party REFER request. This is for situations where the user initiates a call from third-party device, such as PC-based soft phones or click-to-talk feature, but then wants the phone to go offhook and actually place the call
( < offhookOnRefer > )
Use Preloaded Route FALSE If checked, a SIP Route: header is added in outgoing messages to request the outbound proxy to be included in all return paths
( < usePreloadedRoute > )
Block Caller ID FALSE If checked, this prevents your Caller ID from being shown to other party
( < callerIdBlocking > )


Incoming Invite PAId-From-Contact PAId-Contact-From PAId-From-Contact Caller Name Search Precedence in Incoming Invite
( < incomingInvite > )
200 OK of Invite PAId-Contact-To PAId-To-Contact PAId-To-Contact Caller Name Search Precedence in 200 OK of Invite
( < okOfInvite > )
Outbound SIP Proxy Primary Outbound Proxy Address Domain name or IP address of primary outbound proxy
( < proxyAddress > )
SIP PING for Server Redundancy FALSE If checked SIP PING will be used for server redundancy
( < sipPingForServerRedundancy > )


Secondary Outbound Proxy Address Domain name or IP address of secondary outbound proxy
( < proxyAddress1 > )
Proxy Usage Mode noneThroughProxy forwardAllThroughProxy forwardAllThroughProxy If any of the Outbound Proxy Addresses is specified and forwardAllThroughProxy option is selected, all SIP messages except REGISTER are sent through proxy. If noneThroughProxy is selected only the dialed numbers and unresolved URIs go through the proxy
( < sipProxy > )
Register Through Proxy TRUE If checked and any of the Outbound Proxy Addresses is specified, SIP REGISTER messages are sent through the proxy
( < registerThroughProxy > )


RTP Settings RTP Port 5012 Starting RTP port
( < rtpPort > )
Transmit DTMF info inband rfc2833 rfc2833 If info is selected, SIP INFO DTMF as defined in IETF RFC 2976 will be used. If inband is selected, in-band DTMF is used. If rfc2833 is selected, DTMF is injected into the RTP stream as defined in IETF RFC 2833
( < transmitDtmf > )
Preferred Codec g711ulaw g711alaw g729 g711ulaw Preference for audio codec that the phone uses in SDP offer
( < preferredCodec > )
Tone Settings Enable Routing Tone FALSE If checked, a routing tone is played for the brief interval between placing a call and when the remote end starts ringing
( < enableRoutingTone > )
Tone Set US/Canada United Kingdom Australia US/Canada Country specific tones
( < toneSet > )
Miscellaneous Settings Dial Plan When dial plan is present, number dialed when placing a call will be compared against the configured dial plan and if a match is found, then the call will be initiated automatically without the need for pressing the DIAL key
( < sipDialplan > )
Disable FLASH Key During Calls FALSE Disabling FLASH key during calls allows other methods of getting a second dial tone. Selecting RFC 2833 as transmit-DTMF method causes the telephone to simply transmit the RFC 2833 FLASH event instead of the phone handling the FLASH key natively
( < disableCall1_2key > )
Auto Dial FALSE If checked, the Auto Dial User ID gets dialed without any need to enter a number as soon as the handset is picked up or SPEAKER or HEADSET button is pressed if Auto Dial User ID is configured
( < sipAutoDial > )
Auto Dial User ID User ID to be dialed automatically
( < sipAutoDialUserid > )
Disable Call Waiting FALSE If checked, Call Waiting will be disabled so that the phone immediatley rejects an incoming call if there is already an active call on this line
( < disableCallWaiting > )
Disable Star Codes TRUE Disabling call feature codes causes the phone to not process and to instead pass through all key presses for star feature codes, e.g., *67, *69, *70 and *99, for downstream processing
( < disableStarCodes > )
Use only UDP SRV FALSE If checked, phone only use UDP SRV search in order to limit the extent of DNS name resolution searches
( < useOnlyUdpSrv > )
